intro: Luehea seemannii var. chocoensis, commonly known as the Chocó luehea, is a tropical shrub native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and woolly leaves. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their potential anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. The species is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its vibrant blooms and unique foliage.
